title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: Teun van den Brand’s ggarrow package great functionality making great-looking arrows ggplot2.  particularly like arrow functions can resect arrows can put little space arrows objects connect.  can make arrowheads supplying arrow_head parameter 2-column matrix polygon points. ’ll make simple triangle:  can make shape want. made arrowheadr facilitate getting complex shapes box ggarrow functions expect. arrowheadr functions depend ggarrow, designed used ggarrow. main arrow_head_* functions return matrix columns x y create polygon fitting square −1 1 x y axes. main arrow_head_* functions optional plot argument show polygon used:  pink rectangle shows arrow’s line end. arrowhead’s point expected (1,0), can anything want. can now use output ggarrow:
code: library(arrowheadr) library(ggarrow) library(ggplot2) library(ggforce) library(tibble) library(dplyr)  # Make simple plot for reuse base_plot <- data.frame(x = c(0,1), y = c(0,1)) |>    ggplot(aes(x,y)) +    coord_equal()  base_plot +   geom_arrow() base_plot +   geom_arrow(resect = 5) triangle <- cbind(x = c(1, 0, 0),                   y = c(0, .5, -.5))  base_plot +    geom_arrow(arrow_head = triangle) library(arrowheadr) my_arrowhead <- arrow_head_deltoid(plot = TRUE) base_plot +    geom_arrow(arrow_head = my_arrowhead)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: use ggarrow mostly creating path diagrams. setup bit complicated, works .
code: # Set defaults ggplot2::update_geom_defaults("arrow_segment",                               list(                                 length_head = 5,                                 linewidth = 1.5,                                 color = "gray20"                               )) ggplot2::update_geom_defaults("text", list(family = "Asap Condensed")) ggplot2::update_geom_defaults("label", list(family = "Asap Condensed"))      # Names and locations of latent variables d_latent <- tibble(   x = c(0, .5, 1),   y = c(0, sqrt(3) / 2, 0),   construct = c("A", "B", "C") )  # Circle size node_radius <- .15  # Distance from circle to start and end arrows path_offset <- .03 p_offset <- node_radius + path_offset  # Paths between variables d_edge <- tibble(   from = c("A", "A", "B"),   to = c("B", "C", "C"),   value = c(".75", ".11", ".90") ) |>   left_join(d_latent |>               rename(                 from = construct,                 from_x = x,                 from_y = y               ),             by = join_by(from)) |>   left_join(d_latent |>               rename(to = construct,                      to_x = x,                      to_y = y),             by = join_by(to)) |>   mutate(     start_x = from_x + p_offset * (to_x - from_x),     end_x = from_x + (1 - p_offset) * (to_x - from_x),     start_y = from_y + p_offset * (to_y - from_y),     end_y = from_y + (1 - p_offset) * (to_y - from_y)   )  # Function to create a plot and replace arrows  mypath <- function(arrow_head = ggarrow::arrow_head_wings(),                     node_radius = .15,                     path_offset = .03,                     ...) {    p_offset <- node_radius + path_offset    ggplot(d_edge, aes(      x = start_x,      y = start_y,      xend = end_x,      yend = end_y    )) +      coord_equal() +      theme_void() +      geom_circle(        data = d_latent,        aes(          x0 = x,          y0 = y,          r = node_radius,          fill = construct        ),        color = NA,        inherit.aes = FALSE      ) +      geom_text(        data = d_latent,        aes(x = x, y = y, label = construct),        size = 18,        inherit.aes = FALSE,        color = "gray20"       ) +      theme(legend.position = "none") +      scale_fill_viridis_d(        option = "D",        begin = .2,        end = .8,        alpha = .5      ) +      geom_arrow_segment(arrow_head = arrow_head,                          ...) +      geom_circle(aes(          x0 = from_x + .5 * (to_x - from_x),          y0 = from_y + .5 * (to_y - from_y),          r = .042),          fill = "white",          color = NA) +      geom_text(        aes(          x = from_x + .5 * (to_x - from_x),          y = from_y + .5 * (to_y - from_y),          label = value        ),        size = 6,        color = "gray20"       )  }

code: # A normal distribution xy <- arrow_head_function(dnorm, plot = TRUE)  # if closed = FALSE, set thickness and base_width xy <- arrow_head_function(dnorm, plot = TRUE, closed = FALSE,                     thickness = 1.5,                     base_width = .25)   # A cauchy distribution xy <- arrow_head_function(dt, df = 1, plot = TRUE)  # open with thickness = 1.5 xy <- arrow_head_function(   dt,   df = 1,   plot = TRUE,   closed = FALSE,   thickness = 1.5 )  # thickness > 2 creates a bulge xy <- arrow_head_function(   dt,   df = 1,   lower_bound = -3.25,   upper_bound = 3.25,   closed = F,   thickness = 2.5,   plot = TRUE,   rescale = 1 / 3,   nudge = c(2 / 3, 0) )   # Make a new function mytrident <- function(x, s = 160) {   k <- length(x)   y1 <- dbeta(x, shape1 = s, shape2 = s) * 2   y2 <- dbeta(x, shape1 = s * .9, shape2 = s * .1)   y3 <- dbeta(x, shape1 = s * .1 , shape2 = s * .9)   y1 + y2 + y3 }  xy <- arrow_head_function(   mytrident,   lower_bound = 0,   upper_bound = 1,   plot = T,   minimum_value = -3,   rescale = .5,   nudge = c(.5, 0) )
